ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies an incremental update to a cube.

Specifies a limit on the number of indices that will be created in parallel during 
the cube build process.

Specifies that the cube build will include an additional summarization step that
is designed to decrease the size of the NWAY aggregation and improve viewing
performance.
Specifies whether or not to store the aggregation tables in a compressed format on disk.
Specifies whether or not to store the aggregation tables in a compressed format on disk.
Specifies the maximum number of aggregations to create in parallel.
Specifies a valid SAS name for the cube to be created, renamed, or updated.
Specifies the data source for the cube.
Specifies the location of one or more partitions in which to place aggregation table data.
Deletes the physical cube that is specified with the CUBE= option.

Deletes the physical cube that is specified with the CUBE= option but leaves the cube 
definition intact.
Specifies up to 200 characters to be stored as descriptive text.
Specifies an optional drill-through table.

Specifies the quoted text string that identifies members of character levels that are 
to be skipped or disregarded.

Specifies the quoted text string that identifies members of numeric levels that are 
to be skipped or disregarded.
Specifies the ESRI map server to which this cube should be linked.

Indicates that any existing associations to ESRI metadata should be replaced with those 
specified in this PROC OLAP session.

When specified while building a cube from a star schema, causes SAS to ignore an error 
condition, log the error, and continue building the cube.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The SAS log receives an entry that lists the total number of key values that are missing  from each dimension table.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The SAS log receives an entry that lists the total number of key values that are missing  from each dimension table, and the missing keys are listed for each dimension table.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies whether or not to create the aggregations with indexes.
Specifies whether or not to create the aggregations with indexes.

Specifies the locations of the index component files that correspond to each aggregation 
table partition as specified by the DATAPATH= option.
Specifies the amount of memory in megabytes that is available when aggregations are being created.

Specifies the number of times proc OLAP will attempt to reconnect to the metadata server after 
a connection is lost.

Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait before PROC OLAP attempts to reconnect 
to the metadata server.

Specifies the maximum number of threads that are used to asynchronously create the 
aggregation indexes.

Specifies the initial number of seconds to wait before PROC OLAP attempts to reconnect 
to the metadata server.

Prevents PROC OLAP from automatically creating an NWAY aggregation (the crossing of all 
dimension levels) for the new cube.

Specifies that the dimension (or dimensions) for a cube should be built with the minimum 
amount of disk space to represent the members available when the cube is created.
Specifies a valid SAS name for the new cube registration.
Specifies the name of the OLAP schema into which a new cube should be placed.

Specifies the partition size in megabytes of the aggregation table partitions and their 
corresponding index components.
Specifies the physical path to the location of a new cube.

Specifies that metadata for a cube is to be registered, but the cube is not to be 
physically built.
Indicates that the cube should be renamed.
Enables you to reorganize all eligible levels for a cube.
Controls how permission conditions are interpreted at query time.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Does not recalculate the cell values.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies the number of observations (table rows) in the file segment of the 
index component.

Synchronizes the column names stored in the cube's internal metadata with the input 
column names for a cube.

Enables you to update the captions for dimensions, hierarchies, levels, member properties, 
and measures.
Enables you to control how the updated cube is made available to users.
Specifies one or more locations for temporary work files.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the name of the schema that has been defined in a SAS metadata repository.
Specifies the IP address of the metadata repository host.
Specifies the numeric value of the port on which the metadata repository resides.
Specifies the password for the user identified with the USERID= option.

Specifies the name of a SAS metadata repository in which existing cube metadata 
information exists or in which metadata about a new cube is stored.
Specifies the user's identification for the specified metadata repository.
Specifies the name of one or more hierarchies as defined by HIERARCHY statements.

Specifies a maximum of 200 characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the dimension.

Specifies any number of characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the dimension.

Specifies the name of a column in the dimension table that is specified in the 
DIMTBL= option.

Specifies the two-level SAS name or a dimension table that matches the fact table that 
is specified with the FACT= option in the PROC OLAP statement.

Specifies the library for the data sets that exist, for this dimension, in each language 
that is specified by the USER_DEFINED_TRANSLATIONS statement.
Specifies the member prefix for the translated dimension tables.

Specifies the text string that identifies members of character levels that are to be 
skipped or disregarded.

Specifies the text string that identifies members of numeric levels that are to be 
skipped or disregarded.

Specifies the name of the column in the fact table that corresponds to the dimension 
table column that is specified with the DIMKEY= option.

Specifies that, for this hierarchy, any values that were specified for the EMPTY_CHAR= 
and EMPTY_NUM= options in the PROC OLAP statement are to be ignored.
Specifies the map service to which this cube should be linked.

Specifies that the dimension should be built with the minimum amount of disk space to 
represent the members available when the cube is created.
Specifies a sort order for all levels in the dimension.
Identifies the dimension as a TIME or GEO dimension.

Enables you to add new members to a cube and update member properties for existing 
members of the dimension.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LEVEL level-name <option(s)>;

The LEVEL statement provides additional information about a level specified
with the LEVELS= option in a HIERARCHY statement, and enables you to set
options for ragged hierarchies.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies a maximum of 200 characters that can be used to create a meaningful 
description of the level.
Specifies the name of a column from the input data source.

Specifies any number of characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the level.
Specifies the text string that identifies members that are to be skipped or disregarded.
Specifies the ESRI map layer which should be associated with this level.

Specifies the SAS format to be used when reading in the member caption data from the 
input data source for the LEVEL.

Specifies that any value of the EMPTY_CHAR= option (for character levels) or
EMPTY_NUM= option (for numeric levels) that was specified in the respective
HIERARCHY or PROC OLAP statement is to be ignored.
Specifies a sort order for a level within a dimension.

Specifies the time period for the dimension levels when you specify the TYPE=TIME option 
in the DIMENSION statement.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROPERTY prop-name LEVEL=level-name <option(s)>;

The PROPERTY statement assigns properties to specific levels within specified hierarchies.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies a valid SAS name for the property.

Specifies a maximum of 200 characters that can be used to create a meaningful
description of the level.
Specifies the name of a column from the input data source.

Specifies any number of characters that can be used to create a meaningful
description of the level.
Specifies the field of the map layer to be associated with the level.
Specifies the name of one or more hierarchies that contain the level.
Specifies the ESRI mapping properties for the cube levels that you are mapping to.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: HIERARCHY hier-name LEVELS=(level-name1 <level-name2 ...level-nameN>) <option(s)>;

The HIERARCHY statement specifies the navigational order of the levels in a dimension.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies a valid SAS name for at least one level.
Specifies the caption for the ALL member of the hierarchy.

Specifies a maximum of 200 characters that can be used to create a meaningful 
description of the hierarchy.

Identifies a hierarchy as the default hierarchy for the dimension that is defined 
by the DIMENSION statement.

Specifies any number of characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the hierarchy.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: MEASURE measure-name STAT=statname <option(s)>;

The MEASURE statement defines the cube's measures and indicates how they map to the input data.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the statistic for the measure.
Specifies the name of a numeric column that is contained in the cube's input data source.

Specifies the name of the numeric column in the summarized input data that contains the 
values for the measure.

Specifies a maximum of 200 characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the measure.
Identifies a measure as the default measure for the cube.

Specifies any number of characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the measure.
Specifies the SAS format to be used to display the value of the measure.
Specifies the hierarchy in which the level resides.
Specifies that calculated members are included in the NUNIQUE count for the measure statement.
Specifies the level for which a unique count is determined.
Specifies that calculated members are not included in the MEASURE statement.
Specifies that calculated members are not included in the MEASURE statement.

Specifies a maximum of 256 characters that can be used to create a meaningful description 
of the measure's units (for example, "pounds sterling").
Specifies whether or not to store the aggregation table in a compressed format on disk.
Specifies whether or not to store the aggregation table in a compressed format on disk.
Specifies the location of one or more partitions in which to place aggregation table data.
Specifies whether or not to create the specified aggregation with indexes.
Specifies whether or not to create the specified aggregation with indexes.

Specifies the locations of the index component files that correspond to each aggregation 
table partition as specified by the DATAPATH= option.
Specifies a maximum of 256 characters as the name of the aggregation.

Specifies the partition size in megabytes of the aggregation table partitions and their 
corresponding index components.
Specifies the number of observations (table rows) in the file segment of the index component.
Specifies the name of a SAS data set or data view that contains the data for one aggregation.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DROP_AGGREGATION level-name1 < level-name2 ...level-nameN> / NAME=aggregation-name ; 

The DROP_AGGREGATION statement removes an aggregation from the specified cube.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies the name of the aggregation that you want to drop.
Indicates whether you are creating a calculated member or a named set.
Indicates whether you are creating a calculated member or a named set.
Specifies the MDX expression.
Indicates whether you are creating a calculated member or a named set.
Indicates whether you are creating a calculated member or a named set.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: USER_DEFINED_TRANSLATIONS locale <locale2 ...localeN> ;  

The USER_DEFINED_TRANSLATIONS statement is required to use the Multiple
Language Support capabilities of the SAS OLAP Server. This statement specifies
the locales that are associated with the data sets that you specify in the
DIMENSION statement.

Syntax: REORGANIZE_LEVEL | REORG_LEVEL ;  

This option enables you to reorganize individual, eligible levels for a cube.
It is used when you have performed multiple cube updates on a cube such that
the levels values must be reorganized. Any level used in this statement must
have been updated with new captions during prior instances of cube update.
